consoleIO

Class ConsoleInputInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • consoleIO.ConsoleInputInterface

  • public class ConsoleInputInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    This boundary class gets input from the user via the console. It handles possible bad input from the user

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.Scanner consoleScanner 

    • Constructor Summary

      ConsoleInputInterface() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean getUserBooleanInput(java.lang.String promptMessage)
      This method keeps prompting the user to enter a Yes or No till the user enters Y or N.
      static int getUserPositiveIntInput(java.lang.String promptMessage)
      This method keeps prompting the user to enter a positive integer input till the user enters a positive integer.
      static int getUserPositiveIntInput(java.lang.String promptMessage, int upperbound)
      This method keeps prompting the user to enter a positive integer input till the user enters a positive integer that is lower than or equal to the upperbound.
      static java.lang.String getUserStringInput(java.lang.String promptMessage, StringFormatType stringFormatType)
      This method keeps prompting the user to enter a String of the right format till the user do so.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserPositiveIntInput

        public static int getUserPositiveIntInput(java.lang.String promptMessage)
        This method keeps prompting the user to enter a positive integer input till the user enters a positive integer. It then returns the positive integer.
        Parameters:
        promptMessage -
        Returns:
        userInput

      • getUserPositiveIntInput

        public static int getUserPositiveIntInput(java.lang.String promptMessage,
                                          int upperbound)
        This method keeps prompting the user to enter a positive integer input till the user enters a positive integer that is lower than or equal to the upperbound. Either the prompting message or an earlier message should make it clear to the user what the upperbound is. This method then returns the positive integer.
        Parameters:
        promptMessage -
        Returns:
        userInput

      • getUserBooleanInput

        public static boolean getUserBooleanInput(java.lang.String promptMessage)
        This method keeps prompting the user to enter a Yes or No till the user enters Y or N. Either the prompting message or an earlier message should make it clear to the user what characters are legal to enter (Y, y ,N, n). This method then returns the boolean value (Yes -> true, No -> false).
        Parameters:
        promptMessage -
        Returns:
        userInput

      • getUserStringInput

        public static java.lang.String getUserStringInput(java.lang.String promptMessage,
                                                  StringFormatType stringFormatType)
        This method keeps prompting the user to enter a String of the right format till the user do so. This method then returns the String entered.
        Parameters:
        promptMessage, - stringFormatType
        Returns:
        userInput
